170011242.review:
I'm dead serious when I say that PUBG mobile is better than this. Not that PUBG mobile is much better. I loved playing PUBG mobile, but the PC version is just full of cheaters unlike in mobile. Devs don't do anything to cheaters, they just don't care. There is no balance in ranked games and only cheaters. Also now that I think about it the game is kind of boring and empty battle royale game, I guess that's what made Fortnite so successful, they made the game feel meaningful and fun despite the unrealistic gun mechanics and graphics. But back to the point, PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS (pc version) has stiff controls and movement, frequent performance issues including the fact that the game was paid at one point, no shit. Complete waste of money. Not worth playing in 2024.

I will give it 3 out of 10.

171572068.review:
Full of Cheaters and Unjust Bans

I've been playing PUBG since launch with over 500 hours logged. Despite not being an amazing player, I've enjoyed the game immensely and have always played fairly. However, today I experienced something incredibly frustrating and unfair.

In the span of three games:

The first game, I got killed by blatant hackers.
The second game was fine.
In the third game, I received a 24-hour ban for "cheats/hacks," despite never having cheated in my life.
My Steam account is pristine and has been for years, yet I'm punished while actual cheaters run rampant. This is beyond disappointing and shows a severe flaw in the game's anti-cheat system. Legitimate players like myself are getting banned, while the real cheaters continue to ruin the experience for everyone else.

PUBG needs to seriously address this issue. Until then, I cannot recommend this game. If you value fair play and a good gaming experience, look elsewhere.

170986944.review: Ever feel the rush of running for your life in a dinosaur onesie? Well, look no further than PUBG Battlegrounds. It's basically a game of hide-and-seek but with frying pans and ghillie suits on very high stakes. From parachuting deep into nowhere to strategic camping in a bush, it is all action—unless, of course, you get sniped from 800 meters away. 10/10 would get ambushed by a guy in a clown mask again.

170269511.review:
Save your sanity, go and play something else.

The game is completely and utterly compromised by cheaters. Used you be you'd see one in every 50 games who was obviously, now it's every other game you play and it gets worse every single season. Die to anyone in the game, look up their stats on one of the stat sites and it's either:-

-> Brand new account that's never played the game before on a 7k/d and 50%+ headshot rate
-> Account that's been dormant for 25+ seasons and suddenly playing again on a 50%+ headshot rate
-> Account that has 350 games played in the last 2 seasons with a 24k/d, 70% headshot rate and 1k average damage

Usually these are hacked accounts or a cheater who's been banned just making a new steam account to continue cheating because the game has literally no controls to stop this. 

If it's not one of the above that kills you, it's someone from some internet cafe in China or Kosovo playing with 700+ ms who kills you from the future/past when you're 5 meters behind cover because the game has no ping or region lock. The developers are either complicit in cheating or are incompetent as to how to prevent it - and are too preoccupied making the worst cash shop known to man to milk money out of the whales still playing.

170478251.review: I'll give credits where its due, this game popularized the battle royale genre, but it falls massively short compared to its competition. Not to mention the fact that despite the game mentioning some sort of skill based matchmaking system, it actually doesn't work for shit. If you're planning to start this game in 2024 and on, give up. The controls are janky and weird, forcing you to go into your controls settings to rearrange. 169826402.review:
The new privacy policy is insane,

it allows them to acess and store (*and share) ridiculous amounts of information that they have no buisiness knowing.

I have puchased this game years ago and now they block me from playing it unless i forefeit my right to privacy?

I consider this to be fraud.


Edit: here are some examples:

information that they collect includes:

– Nickname, phone number, SteamID64(*), purchase history, etc. to provide and operate the game;*

– Nickname, email address, device information, and records of the issues you experience (to provide customer service)*, and

– Email address, gender, age, country of residence, language, and information for delivering goods (i.e. name, postal address, and phone number)(for participation in the survey, and other events).*

When you participate in social features (such as in-game chat), the information that you disclose is public information. We may store and access it, and it may be read, copied, collected or used by other users without your consent.

*When they name a reason for collecting this and that information it doesn't legally bind them as far as I can tell.
It seems to be just an explanation for the reader, especially considering this list is under "information we collect" and not "how we use your information", that comes later.



who they share the information with includes:

marketing platforms and providers of analytics services relating to player behavior*, in order to tailor the Service and to conduct marketing activities
*this does not mean that they only share information that's necessary for the analytics, it means that they are allowed to share what they have with a company that provides those analytics services.
player behavior is also not limited to ingame activities, it can be simply activity of you, the player, as far as the wording goes.



they also retain the right to give out your information if their company is aquired or merged.

We may also share your information where such disclosure is essential to comply with a legal obligation or a lawful data access request, pursuant to a merger or acquisition, with our affiliates for the purposes described in this Policy, or where you have otherwise provided* your consent or at your direction.

*"or where you have otherwise provided your consent" reads like "We may share your information in such and such cases and also however we see fit (as long as it's legal)" bruh💀


please check out the privacy policy to see for yourself:
https://na.battlegrounds.pubg.com/pp-steam/
it's all there and not super hard to understand.



tldr: privacy unknown: bad game 😔

I have never, not once broken a rule, have not even used voice or text chat at all, and i definitely not cheated or abused any glitches in any way. While in one of our casual matches (one of 3 per day enjoyable matches you can play, then they're gone for the day), and i get kicked and get a pop-up saying "you have been banned for 72h due to "unusual activity on your account". I have never had any account issues with this game, never needed to change anything on that front so i haven't. So now i am banned from playing the game for *and i mean this* absolutely NO reason. I submitted a ticket to try to get pubg to remove the false ban or at least EXPLAIN or maybe even apologize, but nope, of course, the response i got back from them said exactly this: Unfortunately, i cannot remove the temporary ban on your account nor be able to disclose specific details of the violation due to security reasons." This is a load of ****. I am done with dealing with all the garbage in this game and community anyway, so I'm done being slapped in the face. As of today I am uninstalling this once fun pile of trash and I am not coming back.          Thanks PUBG.

170598589.review:
Okay, so I tried PUBG for the first time, and now I'm pretty sure I need a support group. It's like they injected adrenaline directly into my eyeballs. Every match starts innocently enough with me saying, "I'll just play one quick round." Cut to four hours later, and I'm sneaking around in a bush, praying nobody sees my bright yellow jacket.

Pros:

Adrenaline Overload: PUBG has more adrenaline than a triple espresso chased with a Red Bull. Every gunshot sends my heart into overdrive, and don't even get me started on the blue zone — it's like my worst nightmare in digital form.

Strategic Genius (or Lack Thereof): Planning? Ha! PUBG taught me that my strategy boils down to "run and hope for the best." Spoiler alert: it rarely works, but hey, I keep trying.

Frying Pan Heroics: I never knew a frying pan could be so versatile. It's saved my digital behind more times than I care to admit. I swear, someday I'll get a chicken dinner solely with that pan.

Cons:

Addiction Warning: Seriously, PUBG should come with a warning label: "May cause neglect of real-life responsibilities and a sudden interest in camouflage fashion."

Glitchy Shenanigans: Sure, the glitches are part of the charm, but not when you're stuck halfway through a wall or your car decides to moonwalk across the map.

Friendship Tester: PUBG has taught me who my real friends are — they're the ones who revive me instead of looting my corpse.

Final Verdict:

PUBG is like that bad influence friend who convinces you to do dumb things but also gives you unforgettable memories. It's a rollercoaster of emotions, from triumphant chicken dinners to face-palming defeats. I can't quit. So, if you see someone crouched in a corner with a frying pan, it's probably me — and I regret nothing.

169861061.review:
I had high hopes for PUBG, but unfortunately, this game fails to deliver on multiple fronts. The experience is marred by glaring issues that make it difficult to enjoy, even for the most patient players.

[b]Rampant Cheating Ruins Fair Play [/b]
One of the most infuriating aspects of PUBG is the overwhelming number of cheaters. It seems that in nearly every match, you'll encounter players using aimbots, wallhacks, or other unfair advantages. This constant barrage of cheating not only destroys the competitive integrity of the game but also saps any fun or sense of achievement from legitimate players.

[b]Unbalanced Matchmaking: A Recipe for Frustration [/b]
Adding insult to injury, the matchmaking system in PUBG is horrendously unbalanced. New players are routinely pitted against seasoned veterans, resulting in wildly lopsided matches. This poor design choice leads to a cycle of frustration and discouragement, especially for those trying to learn the game.

What could have been an enjoyable gaming experience is instead a exercise in frustration. Save your time and money – this game is not worth the headache.

170629613.review:
This game is a complete waste of time. Loot for 20 minutes, then die to someone with level 2500 or a cheater. Macros are everywhere; people shoot without recoil. Matchmaking is a joke. You’re paired with Silvers against level 2500 squads. BattleEye is a useless anti-cheat. They removed items, slashed prices, and made the game free after you spent money.

Events are interesting. Sure, I got both an Aston Martin and a Lamborghini in different passes. But missions are way too repetitive. Interesting game modes appear very rarely, and the matchmaking is a nightmare of terrible genius. As a Diamond 2, playing Ranked (which we paid for) with my Diamond 2 friend, we get matched with and against Silvers who don’t even have level 100. You report a cheater, they get a temporary ban, and if the gods of this lousy game decide, a permanent ban. But your rank and rating? Gone forever. You’re just unlucky.

I’m not a loser to play this game. Even after all the top 1s.

Want to waste your life and ruin your mood? Play PUBG.

171087294.review:
I don't know any other game that fell harder from its high point to the face of the earth. Holy man, I can't describe the amount of disappointment.

Let's start where it all began: PUBG was released in December 2017, and I started playing it then. PUBG became THE BATTLE ROYALE. I had great fun with the game; it was never boring for a good 2 years. All the friends we made during this time—I’ll never forget them.

The downfall began at the end of June 2018 with the release of Sanhok. I really despise this map; it ruined everything that made PUBG great. The game went from a slow to rapid pace, with 100 players in such a small area. It would have been better to just add a TDM mode, WHICH THEY ADDED WAY TOO LATE. They added a map no one wanted to play, and they removed the map selection. So you always had the chance to either play a nice round of Erangel or Miramar. I loved both, and although it took some time to adjust to Miramar, I loved it regardless. But the chance of getting Sanhok—everyone was so pissed and annoyed that we would drop and try to die as fast as possible or, honestly, we mostly quit the round right there and hoped to get the "good maps."

At that point, we couldn’t care less about the completely useless battle passes they added. Anyways, we tried to enjoy the game for what it was: "a simple battle royale" where you didn’t need to grind levels or BP coins or whatever. Some months later, I just stopped playing. I would always come back to check out the new maps, and some of them were really good. Vikendi, finally a snow map—I loved it. But at that point, I felt something wasn’t right. Every single player was insanely good all of a sudden. Did I really lose all my skill in the small amount of time I didn’t play? But then it clicked. The real sweating tryhards, who are all wannabe pro players, never stopped playing, and the casual players we played with most of the time were gone. The only ones left were either the streamers or the tryhards.

And this feeling got so much worse every week. So, of course, I wanted to get better. Which, at that point, was still achievable. But in the current day, it’s almost impossible since the current player level is way too high for new players or even returning players. I don’t have the time, after working and getting all my daily life things done, to play for 8 hours just to improve. And with the decline of the player base, you see way more cheaters in your games, which makes it even more miserable since you can't improve against someone who just one-taps you from 500 meters, even when in full sprint.

Anyways, let's look into the abysmal shop they have created. Since I’ve already spent over $3k on this game, I really discourage anyone from buying anything. If you want a weapon skin, check the marketplace on Steam. Most of the cool stuff is behind EA loot boxes, which will burn your whole wallet.

But wait, there's more. Want the really cool and unique weapon skins? Good luck. Those are way too expensive for the normal player base, and of course, they are time-limited. They really want to push you to get those since you don’t know when or if they’ll come back ever again.

Cheaters don’t get banned anymore. Most of the players I reported got a 24-hour ban even though they clearly killed our entire squad with no clear vision.

Please, I beg everyone to stop supporting this game.

TL;DR: It was the best battle royale for a good year. Today, this game is infested with cheaters and filled with loot boxes that bleed you dry. Don't bother with this game.

171875866.review: I am a 54 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son who is now 14. My son got this game from his uncle for Christmas in 2023, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week, he had spent 24 hours on the game. This was terrible for me because it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son because he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to create a Steam account and get this game to see if I could play with him. I loved it, it was the best time I ever spent with my son. Since then, this game has brought me and my son closer together, and now we actually spend time together outside of the house. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has given me and my son many happy memories.

The new privacy policy is insane,

it allows them to acess and store (*and share) ridiculous amounts of information that they have no buisiness knowing.

I have puchased this game years ago and now they block me from playing it unless i forefeit my right to privacy?

I consider this to be fraud.


Edit: here are some examples:

information that they collect includes:

– Nickname, phone number, SteamID64(*), purchase history, etc. to provide and operate the game;*

– Nickname, email address, device information, and records of the issues you experience (to provide customer service)*, and

– Email address, gender, age, country of residence, language, and information for delivering goods (i.e. name, postal address, and phone number)(for participation in the survey, and other events).*

When you participate in social features (such as in-game chat), the information that you disclose is public information. We may store and access it, and it may be read, copied, collected or used by other users without your consent.

*When they name a reason for collecting this and that information it doesn't legally bind them as far as I can tell.
It seems to be just an explanation for the reader, especially considering this list is under "information we collect" and not "how we use your information", that comes later.



who they share the information with includes:

marketing platforms and providers of analytics services relating to player behavior*, in order to tailor the Service and to conduct marketing activities
*this does not mean that they only share information that's necessary for the analytics, it means that they are allowed to share what they have with a company that provides those analytics services.
player behavior is also not limited to ingame activities, it can be simply activity of you, the player, as far as the wording goes.



they also retain the right to give out your information if their company is aquired or merged.

We may also share your information where such disclosure is essential to comply with a legal obligation or a lawful data access request, pursuant to a merger or acquisition, with our affiliates for the purposes described in this Policy, or where you have otherwise provided* your consent or at your direction.

*"or where you have otherwise provided your consent" reads like "We may share your information in such and such cases and also however we see fit (as long as it's legal)" bruh💀


please check out the privacy policy to see for yourself:
https://na.battlegrounds.pubg.com/pp-steam/
it's all there and not super hard to understand.



tldr: privacy unknown: bad game 😔

1. You drop
2. Loot for 15 minutes
3. Get insane loot
4. Die to a 500th LVL player
They should make training map so people can practice their aim.
I can't say it's a good game, mostly due to the vast majority of its player base trying to get under your skin to make you as angry as they are.
I don't blame them. This game is so flawed in many aspects, and no amount of perks will ever fix that.
Take it from me. You could spend your time doing much better things, like learning to cook Bucatini with mushrooms & sausage.

Hell, let me teach you how:

You'll need:
-1 lb Bucatini pasta
-1/2 lb Italian sausage, casings removed
-8 oz sliced mushrooms
-1/2 onion, chopped
-2 cloves garlic, minced
-1/2 cup dry white wine
-1 cup chicken or vegetable broth
-1/2 cup heavy cream
-1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
-2 tbsp chopped fresh parsley
-2 tbsp olive oil
-Salt and pepper, to taste

Cook the Bucatini pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water until it's al dente. Drain and set aside.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the Italian sausage and cook for 8–10 minutes, breaking it up into small pieces with a wooden spoon, until it's browned and fully cooked. Remove the sausage from the skillet and set it aside.

In the same skillet, sauté sliced mushrooms, chopped onions, and minced garlic for 3–4 minutes, until the mushrooms are tender.

Pour dry white wine into the skillet and cook for 1–2 minutes, until the liquid has reduced by half.

Add chicken or vegetable broth to the skillet and bring it to a simmer. Let the mixture cook for 5–7 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.

Stir in the cooked sausage, heavy cream, and grated Parmesan cheese until the cheese has melted, and the sauce is creamy.

Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
Divide the cooked Bucatini pasta onto serving plates and spoon the mushroom and sausage sauce over the top. Garnish with chopped parsley and additional Parmesan cheese, if desired.
You're done! Go prepare some nice pasta and impress your friends.

167240635.review: The Tiananmen Square protests, known in China as the June Fourth Incident,[1][2][a] were student-led demonstrations held in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, China, lasting from 15 April to 4 June 1989. After weeks of unsuccessful attempts between the demonstrators and the Chinese government to find a peaceful resolution, the Chinese government declared martial law on the night of 3 June and deployed troops to occupy the square in what is referred to as the Tiananmen Square massacre. The events are sometimes called the '89 Democracy Movement,[b] the Tiananmen Square Incident,[c] or the Tiananmen uprising.The protests were precipitated by the death of pro-reform Chinese Communist Party (CCP) general secretary Hu Yaobang in April 1989 amid the backdrop of rapid economic development and social change in post-Mao China, reflecting anxieties among the people and political elite about the country's future. The reforms of the 1980s had led to a nascent market economy that benefited some people but seriously disadvantaged others, and the one-party political system also faced a challenge to its legitimacy. Common grievances at the time included inflation, corruption, limited preparedness of graduates for the new economy,[5] and restrictions on political participation. Although they were highly disorganized and their goals varied, the students called for things like rollback of the removal of "iron rice bowl" jobs, greater accountability, constitutional due process, democracy, freedom of the press, and freedom of speech. Workers' protests were generally focused on inflation and the erosion of welfare. These groups united around anti-corruption demands, adjusting economic policies, and protecting social security.At the height of the protests, about one million people assembled in the square.

165991539.review:
[h1]A little bit outdated, but with charm[/h1]
If you want a Battle Royal, where you loot 30 minutes just to get stomped by "Semi-Pros" and that every round, this is exactly your game.

[h3]A hard start[/h3]
Although the first sentence is exaggerated, it holds a lot of truth. You'll fail a lot as a beginner, but that makes the eventual success sweeter. The slow progression of each (normal) round lets you value your live even more. If you make it to the late game, you'll experience an unmatched adrenaline-rush.
And they added some quicker, more arcade-like modes.

[h3]A trip to the past[/h3]
This game hasn't changed a lot since 2017, which could make it look outdated in comparison to it's competitors. But it also conquered it's own niche.

It is impressive that the game plays worse in 2024 than when it was released. My computer is better now and somehow the game runs worse. When the framerate drops from 130 to 60, the game becomes unresponsive and the input lags, rendering it impossible to have any control over the camera or your character.

When you leave a match, rarely the game goes back to the menu. It is more common that it will just soft lock itself into a nice-looking background image. (yes, it wasn't loading, I checked.)

I'm sorry for the developers working on this, I can imagine there are good and competent professionals on the team, but somehow, even with the the huge pile of money this game was able to make, it is still a buggy, janky and unpleasant game. I had fun playing it back when it was released, but the magic worn out and now the lack of quality of this game is more visible than ever.

The art direction and visuals are fine.

169746773.review:
[b]If you're into intense, heart-pounding action, "PUBG Battlegrounds" is a game you need to check out. This isn't just another shooter; it's a full-on battle-royale experience that has hooked millions of players around the world.[/b]

[h1]Graphics and Visuals:[/h1]
[i]First off, the graphics are pretty solid. The game's environments are detailed, from lush forests to barren deserts. Each map has its own unique feel, making each game a new adventure. Sure, it's not the most graphically advanced game out there, but it gets the job done and runs smoothly on most setups.[/i]

[h1]Gameplay and Mechanics:[/h1]
[i]The core of PUBG is simple: you drop into a map with up to 99 other players, scavenge for weapons and gear, and fight to be the last one standing. The shrinking play zone keeps you on your toes, forcing you to strategize and adapt on the fly. What sets PUBG apart is its realistic shooting mechanics and the variety of weapons and attachments you can find. Every match feels different, and the thrill of outsmarting opponents is unbeatable.[/i]

[h1]Sound and Immersion:[/h1]
[i]The sound design is top-notch. You'll find yourself holding your breath when you hear footsteps nearby, trying to pinpoint the direction of gunfire, or the sound of a distant vehicle approaching. The audio cues are crucial for survival and add a lot to the tension and excitement of each game.[/i]

[h1]Community and Multiplayer:[/h1]
[i]Playing solo is fun, but teaming up with friends in duo or squad mode brings another level of excitement. Communication and teamwork are key to winning, and coordinating with your squad can lead to some epic moments. The community is vast, and while you'll encounter some toxic players, there are also plenty of opportunities to meet new friends and allies.[/i]

[h1]Comparing to Other Battle-Royales:[/h1]
[i]Compared to other battle-royale games like Fortnite or Apex Legends, PUBG leans more towards realism. There's no building structures or super abilities, just pure, tactical survival. This might appeal more to players who enjoy a more grounded and strategic gameplay experience.[/i]

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Realistic and intense gameplay
[*]Detailed maps with unique environments
[*]Strong sound design that enhances immersion
[*]Variety of weapons and attachments
[*]Great fun with friends in duo or squad modes
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Graphics aren't the most advanced
[*]Can be a bit buggy at times
[*]The learning curve might be steep for new players
[/list]

[h1]Final Thoughts:[/h1]
[i]"PUBG Battlegrounds" offers a raw and thrilling battle-royale experience that stands out for its realism and strategy. Whether you're a seasoned gamer or new to the genre, PUBG has something to offer. Just be ready for some intense matches and the occasional heart-stopping moments. This game is definitely worth a try for any battle-royale fan.[/i]

167329057.review:
Title: PUBG's Disappointing Descent into a Freak Show

As a long-time fan of PUBG, I am deeply frustrated and disappointed with the direction this game has taken. What once was a gritty, intense survival battle royale has now devolved into an absurd carnival of pink bunny costumes and a rainbow atmosphere.

PUBG started with a clear vision: a realistic, high-stakes battle where survival depended on strategy and skill. The adrenaline rush of being the last one standing in a harsh environment was what drew me in. But now, that essence is completely lost.

The game is now a freak show, cluttered with bizarre, inappropriate content that clashes with its original spirit. Seeing players in garish pink bunny outfits feels like a slap in the face to those of us who cherished PUBG's realistic, survivalist roots. This whimsical, cartoonish aesthetic is not what I signed up for.

Moreover, the frequent collaborations with childish girl bands only make it worse. Instead of teaming up with brands that align with PUBG's intense atmosphere, the developers seem intent on chasing trends that have no place in a game that once prided itself on mature, brutal gameplay.

It's disheartening to see a game with so much potential lose its way so dramatically. The developers' focus on adding superficial content instead of enhancing the core gameplay experience is a huge misstep. PUBG no longer feels like the game I fell in love with; it feels like a cheap, desperate attempt to appeal to a broader audience.

Until the developers remember what made PUBG great—its authenticity, intensity, and true survival battle royale experience—it's hard to see a future for this game that doesn't involve more frustration and disappointment.
